paper_metadata.title: Intergenerational poverty dynamics and pathways out of poverty in rural Philippines

program_information.program_name: Land reform and Green Revolution programs

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: Land and tenancy reforms, which aim to provide the landless or near landless with better access to land, as well as the 'Green Revolution', which aims to increase land productivity, are good examples.

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: we sequentially examines the determinants of schooling, subsequent occupational choices, and current non-farm earnings for the same individuals
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: using long-term panel data collected in the rural Philippines in 1979 and 2003

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Land and tenancy reforms, which aim to provide the landless or near landless with better access to land, as well as the 'Green Revolution', which aims to increase land productivity
evidence_citations.country_citation: using long-term panel data collected in the rural Philippines in 1979 and 2003
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: poverty remains an unresolved global issue... poverty is overwhelmingly a rural phenomenon in most developing countries
